required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Systemic Propranolol for the Treatment of Paediatric Patients With Infantile Hemangiomas
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Systemic Propranolol Treatment on the Physical Development of Paediatric Patients With Infantile Hemangiomas

brief_summary.textblock: This is retrospective study. The patients treated with oral propranolol at a dose of 2.0 mg/kg per day. Growth parameters (height and weight) were measured at the beginning, the end of treatment and 2 years after treatment. The weight-for-age Z-score (WAZ), height-for-age Z-score (HAZ) and weight-for-height Z-score (WHZ) calculated by the WHO Anthro software were used to assess physical development, and the WHO Child Growth Standards were used as the standards.

primary_outcome.measure: Change on the height of the patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the beginning of the treatment, at the end of treatment and 2 years after the treatment
primary_outcome.description: we recorded the height of the patients in meters.

primary_outcome.measure: Change on the weight of the patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the beginning of the treatment, at the end of treatment and 2 years after the treatment
primary_outcome.description: we recorded the weight of the patients in kilograms.

intervention.description: This retrospective study included 128 patients treated with oral propranolol at a dose of 2.0 mg/kg per day.

study_pop.textblock: Overall, 52 males and 76 females, with a male-to-female ratio of 1:1.46, were included in this study. Of the 128 patients, 16 (12.5%) were born prematurely. The median age at the start of propranolol therapy was 3.75 months (0.5-12.5 months). Propranolol was administered for a median duration of 10.52 months (2-24 months).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- IHs diagnosed by medical history and physical examination
- no previous treatment with other medications
Exclusion Criteria:
- a history or risk of asthma, reactive airway disease, impaired renal or liver function, heart defects or arrhythmia, hypotension and hypersensitivity to propranolol
- Infants who did not adhere to the treatments or attend follow-up visits
- Infants with other known risk factors for developmental delay or growth restriction, such as prematurity, small for gestational age, or other major congenital malformations, were also excluded
- No other treatment was used during the oral propranolol course

reference.citation: Chen ZY, Wang QN, Zhu YH, Zhou LY, Xu T, He ZY, Yang Y. Progress in the treatment of infantile hemangioma. Ann Transl Med. 2019 Nov;7(22):692. doi: 10.21037/atm.2019.10.47. Review.

results_reference.citation: Hoeger PH, Harper JI, Baselga E, Bonnet D, Boon LM, Ciofi Degli Atti M, El Hachem M, Oranje AP, Rubin AT, Weibel L, Léauté-Labrèze C. Treatment of infantile haemangiomas: recommendations of a European expert group. Eur J Pediatr. 2015 Jul;174(7):855-65. doi: 10.1007/s00431-015-2570-0. Epub 2015 May 29. Review.
